title: Brazil's Bolsonaro and Lula battle it out for top job
description: Brazilians on both sides of the political divide say they are anxious ahead of the deciding vote.

title: Seoul crush witnesses describe 'out of control' scene
description: Two 21-year-olds say the sight of first-aiders treating crowds was like something out of a film.

title: PM should come clean over Suella Braverman breach - Labour
description: Labour is calling for risk assessments of Suella Braverman's security breach to be published.

title: The Papers: 'Johnson will attend COP27' and 'Truss hacked'
description: Most of the Sunday papers look at Rishi Sunak's decision not to attend the COP27 climate summit.

title: Meet the designers with learning disabilities
description: A design agency in Barcelona has creatives with learning disabilities, autism and schizophrenia.

title: 'Something terrible is happening': Deadly Halloween crush in Seoul
description: Crowds of revellers pour into a narrow street in the Itaewon district, causing a deadly crush.

title: Bellator 287: Fabian Edwards beats Charlie Ward by unanimous decision
description: Fabian Edwards beats Charlie Ward at Bellator 287 in Milan to edge closer towards a middleweight title shot.

title: Katie Taylor beats Karen Elizabeth Carabajal to remain undisputed lightweight world champion
description: Ireland's Katie Taylor retains her IBF, WBA, WBC, WBO world lightweight titles with a comprehensive win against Karen Elizabeth Carabajal.

title: South Korea: Droves of revellers leave area after deadly Seoul crush
description: Footage shows rescue workers at the scene in Seoul as crowds of revellers leave the bustling area.

title: NI election: Sinn Féin says talks to be held on Tuesday
description: But the DUP warns that the Northern Ireland's secretary's plan for more discussions is "pointless".

title: Mexico City Grand Prix: Max Verstappen on pole with George Russell second
description: Red Bull's Max Verstappen takes pole for the Mexican Grand Prix, fending off a challenge from Mercedes drivers George Russell and Lewis Hamilton.

title: Liz Truss phone hack claim prompts calls for investigation
description: The Mail on Sunday claims the ex-prime minister's phone was hacked while she was foreign secretary.

title: Liverpool 1-2 Leeds: Jurgen Klopp's side stunned by spirited Leeds
description: Crysencio Summerville scores a dramatic late winner as Leeds stun Liverpool to damage the Reds' top-four hopes and move out of the Premier League relegation zone.

title: Halloween: Pig-headed butcher leads scares at Aberdare house
description: One family spends six months turning their home into a must-see Halloween attraction.

title: Raheem Sterling: Chelsea player 'not even in contention' for England's World Cup squad
description: Chelsea's Raheem Sterling is “not even a consideration” for England's World Cup squad on current form, according to BBC Radio 5 Live’s Pat Nevin.

title: Scotland 15-16 Australia: Blair Kinghorn misses late kick as Scots come up just short
description: Scotland fell to defeat in their opening match of the Autumn Nations Series against Australia as Blair Kinghorn missed a last-gasp penalty for victory.

title: Angry drivers remove Just Stop Oil protesters from London roads
description: Scotland Yard say they arrested 33 people during the protests in central London.

title: Shakhtar Donetsk: Ukrainian Premier League game paused for air raid siren
description: Shakhtar Donetsk's Ukrainian Premier League game against Oleksandria in Lviv is paused after an air raid siren.

title: South Korea Halloween crush: Video shows panic as crowd surges
description: Halloween revellers are seen struggling in huge crowds as emergency services attend the scene.

title: Rugby League World Cup: Shaun Wane says England want 'big one' in final
description: Head coach Shaun Wane says England want the "big one" in the World Cup final after crushing debutants Greece to reach the last eight.

title: Ukraine war: Russia halts grain deal after 'massive' Black Sea Fleet attack
description: The UN says it is vital not to imperil the deal, as Ukraine accuses Russia of "using a false pretext".

title: Don't believe it's back to boring, says Laura Kuenssberg
description: Rishi Sunak will be a different kind of PM but it's not the end of the drama, writes Laura Kuenssberg.

title: Dozens in cardiac arrest in Halloween crowds in South Korea
description: Videos show a number of people being treated on the street by emergency services, surrounded by large crowds.

title: Zulu coronation: King Misuzulu crowned in historic South Africa ceremony
description: The coronation of King Misuzulu ka Zwelithini is a watershed moment in South Africa.

title: Brighton & Hove Albion 4-1 Chelsea: Seagulls spoil former boss Graham Potter's Amex Stadium
description: Graham Potter endures a nightmare return to Amex Stadium as Brighton deservedly beat Chelsea to claim their first victory under new manager Roberto de Zerbi.

title: Rugby League World Cup: Dom Young scores four tries for England against Greece
description: Watch as Dominic Young scores four first-half tries against Greece to equal the record for an England international in one match.

title: Rishi Sunak hires ITV journalist Amber de Botton as communications chief
description: The appointment comes as the new prime minister and his family move back into No 10 Downing Street.

title: Rugby League World Cup: England crush Greece as Dom Young scores four tries
description: Dominic Young scores four first-half tries as a rampant England ran in an incredible 17 in total to crush debutants Greece 94-4 - their biggest victory in a World Cup match.

title: Thousands march across UK to demand affordable childcare
description: March of the Mummies campaigners want the government to reform childcare and parental leave.

title: Leicester City 0-1 Manchester City: Kevin de Bruyne's free-kick puts Pep Guardiola's side top of Premier League
description: Manchester City move top of the Premier League after Kevin de Bruyne's stunning second-half free-kick gives them victory over Leicester at King Power Stadium.

title: 'Massive' drone attack on Black Sea Fleet - Russia
description: Russia accuses Ukraine of a major drone attack on its Black Sea Fleet in the Crimean port of Sevastopol.

title: T20 World Cup: Glenn Phillips hits superb ton as New Zealand crush Sri Lanka
description: Glenn Phillips smashes a sublime 104 from 64 balls to lead New Zealand to a crushing 65-run victory over Sri Lanka in the Men's T20 World Cup in Sydney.

title: Fallowfield student stabbing: Man held in murder inquiry
description: Police are not looking for anyone else in connection with the death of 19-year-old Luke O'Connor.

title: Dying dad's Scunthorpe Utd gift to daughter given to charity in error
description: A Scunthorpe Utd shirt, bought for a girl by her dad before he died, was given to charity in error.

title: Mexico City Grand Prix: Ferrari 'not happy' with Red bull budget cap penalty
description: Ferrari say they are "not happy" with the penalty imposed on rivals Red Bull for breaking Formula 1's budget cap.

title: T20 World Cup: Glenn Phillips century leads New Zealand recovery
description: Batter Glenn Phillips drives New Zealand's recovery form a poor start with a century off 61 balls in a crushing 65-run victory over Sri Lanka at the T20 World Cup.

title: T20 World Cup: Sri Lanka collapse to 8-4 against NZ
description: New Zealand reduce Sri Lanka to 8-4 in their T20 World Cup match in Sydney.

title: Octopus Energy to take over collapsed supplier Bulb
description: Bulb's 1.5 million customers will not experience any change to energy supplies, the UK government says.

title: Trevor Noah: I never said entire UK racist, says comic after Rishi Sunak row
description: TV host Trevor Noah was criticised for saying there had been a backlash in the UK to Rishi Sunak.

title: Leicester disorder: Hindu groups set to boycott review
description: Hindu and Jain groups say the academic leading the review has made statements that show serious bias.

title: Losing parents like 'fixing a plane in the air'
description: Chelsea boss Graham Potter says losing his parents during the Covid pandemic was like "fixing a plane in the air" as he speaks about managing mental health as a Premier League manager.

title: T20 World Cup: Sri Lanka take three New Zealand wickets in first four overs
description: Sri Lanka take three New Zealand wickets in the opening four overs of their T20 World Cup match in Sydney.

title: Maurice Hastings: US man in prison for 38 years freed by new DNA evidence
description: Maurice Hastings was wrongfully convicted of murder and repeated requests for DNA testing were denied.

title: British Nigerian artist Dylema paints African women using gold
description: A British Nigerian artist is using pure gold to paint portraits depicting the stories of African diaspora women.

title: Rugby World Cup: England have 'huge fear' of losing Australia quarter-final
description: England's fear of breaking their winning streak is "huge" as they head into Sunday's World Cup quarter-final against Australia, says boss Simon Middleton.

title: World Series 2022: Philadelphia Phillies beat Houston Astros 6-5 as game one goes to extra innings
description: The Philadelphia Phillies overcome a 5-0 deficit to beat the Houston Astros 6-5 in game one of the World Series.

title: Philippines storm Nalgae kills dozens in floods and mudslides
description: Tropical storm Nalgae wreaks havoc in the southern Philippines and will soon lash Manila.

title: Scotland Road: Pubs of Liverpool thoroughfare face last orders
description: Scotland Road once had dozens of bustling pubs, but all that could end as the last one goes up for sale.

title: When do the clocks go back? Big Ben prepares for first change in five years
description: For the first time in five years, the famous clock tower will be put back to GMT this Sunday.

title: Royal Navy investigates after women come forward with abuse claims
description: The head of the Royal Navy issues a statement saying he is disturbed by the "abhorrent" accusations.

title: Will Donald Trump go back on to Twitter?
description: Donald Trump shares a love for Twitter with Elon Musk, its new owner, but times have changed.

title: Ros Atkins on... Brexit and the UK economy
description: Rishi Sunak says he wants to build an economy that embraces the opportunities of Brexit.

title: Ukraine war: Kyiv set for longer power cuts after air strikes
description: Russian strikes on energy infrastructure leave Ukrainians facing power cuts of more than four hours.

title: 'Rental prices make me feel pushed out of my hometown’
description: With prices on the rise, could rents play a part in how people vote at the next election?

title: Escaping the Liverpool race riots of 1919
description: Ernest Marke was attacked by a white mob in Liverpool.

title: Qatar 2022: Why are people protesting about the World Cup host?
description: World Cup host Qatar is receiving complaints over its human rights record and laws on homosexuality.
